"S." The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to include a spending limitation for fiscal year 2006 and beyond. A new point of order is added to prevent consideration of any legislation that exceeds the spending limitation. The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to include a spending limitation for fiscal year 2006 and beyond. A new point of order is added to prevent consideration of any legislation that exceeds the spending limitation, requiring a two-thirds majority vote to waive or suspend it in the House of Representatives or the Senate. The Senate requires a two-thirds majority vote to sustain an appeal of the chair's ruling on a point of order. Appeals are limited to one hour and divided between the mover and the manager of the resolution. SEC. 13. REDUCTION OF FICA RATES RESULTING FROM PERSONAL SOCIAL SECURITY SAVINGS PROGRAM. Employee Contribution: Section 3101 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to reduce the tax rate on employees for Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance in years following a reduction year where the OASDI rate ratio exceeds 125 percent. The term 'reduction year' refers to any year after the transition year where the OASDI rate ratio exceeds 125 percent. The 'transition year' is defined as the first full calendar year following the termination year. The 'reduction percentage' is the excess of the rate in effect under subsection (a). The term 'reduction percentage' is the excess of the rate in effect under subsection (a) for the reduction year over the rate under which the OASDI rate ratio for the reduction year would have been 125 percent. The OASDI rate ratio is the combined balance in the Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund divided by the amount paid from the Trust Funds during a calendar year. The OASDI rate ratio is calculated by dividing the combined balance in the Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund by the amount paid from the Trust Funds during a calendar year, excluding certain transfer payments. The tax rate imposed under subsection (a) will not be reduced below 4.95 percent. Section 3111 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a reduction in the Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance tax rate in subsequent years following a reduction year. The reduction percentage in subsection (a) will not lower the tax rate below 4.95 percent. Section 1401 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a self-employment contribution. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a self-employment contribution that reduces the tax rate under subsection (a) by the reduction percentage in certain years following a reduction year. The terms 'reduction year' and 'reduction percentage' are defined in section 3101(d). The tax rate under subsection (a) cannot be reduced below 9.9 percent.
